main event: Three objects were observed over Douglasville, Georgia, at different times, appearing much brighter than any stars.
interesting points: The objects were observed at different times between September 28 and October 9, 1960., The duration of the observation was approximately 3 to 4 hours., Witnesses described the objects as being possibly ten times brighter than the evening star., The objects showed occasional dance-like movements suggesting variations in altitude., No photographs of the sighting were available.
sighted object: three bright objects in the sky
witness description: A 59-year-old male and his 42-year-old wife; the male was a retired MSG from the USAF.
